ranked_diseases.explanation: Direct match with Case 1 which presented with epileptic spasm and was diagnosed with this condition. Most specific match to patient's phenotype.
Cases 2 and 3 show this diagnosis with infantile spasms, which are a specific type of epileptic spasm. Strong relevance but less direct match than DEE4.
Classic syndrome characterized by epileptic spasms (infantile spasms). Common cause of epileptic spasms in infancy.
X-linked form of DEE that can present with epileptic spasms. Gender (1) suggests male, making X-linked inheritance possible.
Another X-linked DEE that can present with epileptic spasms. Less common than DEE1 but still relevant for male patients.
Can present with epileptic spasms and seizures. Part of the DEE spectrum but less commonly associated with isolated spasms.
X-linked DEE associated with PCDH19 mutations. Can present with epileptic spasms though typically has additional features.
